activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12208
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad,
I‚Äôve refactored the hard-coded usages of `"India"` by updating `careConfig.defaultCountry` to be an object, and replaced direct `"India"` strings with `careConfig.defaultCountry.name` across the codebase, as discussed.

However, some Cypress tests are failing due to timeout errors ‚Äî possibly because `careConfig.defaultCountry.name` is being accessed multiple times in quick succession.

To address this, would it be fine to assign it to a variable like:
> `const defaultCountry = careConfig.defaultCountry.name`

and use `defaultCountry` in place of repeated `"India"` references within the same file?

Let me know if this sounds good, or if you think the issue might be caused by something else.

It‚Äôs not that I didn‚Äôt try ‚Äî from what I could analyze, the issue seems to lie in the dirty state (if I'm not wrong). But I feel I need a better understanding of how it works, and honestly, it‚Äôs a bit overwhelming for me to solve right now. üôÉ
Rather than rushing and submitting a half-baked PR, I think it‚Äôs better to unassign me for now. Thanks for understanding!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11966
activity.text:
Hey @amjithtitus09 üëã

I was able to successfully reproduce the issue for **Diagnosis records** by following these steps:

> Staff Login (as Doctor) ‚Üí Encounters ‚Üí Select a Patient ‚Üí Choose Questionnaire (Diagnosis) / Edit button (under Diagnosis section)

However, I wasn‚Äôt able to reproduce the issue for **Medication Statement**, **Allergy**, and **Symptom** records ‚Äî the **Verification** column seems to be missing in those sections for me. I just wanted to check if I might be missing a step or if this could be related to data setup or user permissions.

That said, since I could reproduce and fix the bug for Diagnosis, I‚Äôve gone ahead and implemented the same solution pattern for the other records as well, even though I couldn‚Äôt directly observe the bug behavior in those.

Would appreciate any clarification here.  
cc: @AdityaJ2305 ‚Äì if you‚Äôve come across this and could share some insight, that‚Äôd be super helpful!

Thanks! üòä

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11843
activity.text:
Hey @nihal467,

I‚Äôve approached this issue by conditionally rendering the questionnaire print button so that it appears on all relevant pages except when the current route corresponds to `facility/..../encouter/.../treatment_summary`.

1) It seems to work fine ‚Äî the button is still there on other pages and hidden where it shouldn‚Äôt be. I've tried to keep the logic simple. Am I good to go with this approach, or would you suggest any changes? üòÑ 

---

2) Also, I know we usually follow certain conventions ‚Äî like keeping UI text in i18n files and so on ‚Äî but I wasn‚Äôt sure if that‚Äôs required here, so I just used it directly for now.

For the route check, I used:
```js
const path = usePath() || "";
const isTreatmentSummaryRoute = path?.includes("/treatment_summary");
```

- Does this look good?
cc @AdityaJ2305 @nihal467

If everything looks fine, I‚Äôll go ahead and raise the PR! üòå

Let me know if any further tweaks are needed ‚Äî otherwise, I‚Äôll go ahead, edit it and push the update. :)
